Lollipop Socks Download free pattern!

I originally designed this pattern for the Woolgirl sock club back in 2010 and got distracted by shawls before I ever released it. The pattern has been completely revisited and improved somewhat to more easily convey the zig zag motif.

Ideally suited for those variegated yarns that none of us can resist buying, Lollipop Socks fly off the needles due to their simple ribbing. If you like the zig zag rib, you can continue the pattern along the foot instead of transitioning to 2×2 ribbing.

When my dad was younger, he and his two brothers dressed up as the boys from the Lollipop Guild for one Halloween. When I told him I was knitting a pattern based on the Lollipop boys, he was ecstatic: he insisted I knit a pair for him (I never did, but his excitement has never wavered even so). This wildly fun yarn stands out in this simple zig zag rib pattern.

The pattern is available for free and includes one size. To up or downsize the pattern, you’ll need to make adjustments to your stitch count in multiples of 4 and tinker with the heel flap as you see fit.

Errata

Version 1 (corrected in Version 2)

Round 2 of leg should read: • p1, k1, p2, repeat from • to end.

Pattern Information

Gauge
32 stitches and 46 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch
Yardage
300 - 350 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)
Yarns
Sunshine Yarns Classic Sock Yarn (Fingering)
Needles
US 1½ - 2.5 mm
Sizes
Fits US women’s shoe size (7–9), expect 8"/20cm foot circumference

Download free pattern!

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
